content.label: One of the best games ever made, Alucard really deserves a new Castlevania game

title.label: Low resolution graphics and terms of conditions

content.label: I purchased this game because of reviews saying it is good/great. But I really dislike games with such low resolution — looks awful on iPad Pro.

title.label: awesome game but bad slow down

content.label: when i first played the game on my ipad mini 2 i noticed that the game has slow down issues please fix it

title.label: Best game ever made - play with controller!!

content.label: I am a 36 year old lady who has never written a game review in my life. I have been playing SOTN since I was about 11 years old, and have bought it on every playstation it has ever been available, and usually go back and play it all the way through once every couple of years.  I saw this pop up in my App Store and the bad reviews truly made me sad and confused. Then I got to thinking about how hard it probably was to play on a touch screen so I started reading these comments. Some wonderful person mentioned that they play this game with their PS4 controller, and I had no idea you could even do that. So I connected my PS4 controller to my iPad and who knew?? This is officially my favorite platform to play this game as long as you have a controller!! It’s smooth and clear, and I just thank you so much for releasing it here!! My childhood lives on...

Controls are awful.  Probably my favorite game growing up. Such a disappointment.  Obviously they didn’t have to spend a lot of time on the graphics because the are exactly like the game from the 90’s so they could have put in a little effort on the controls, If you are not exactly on the button it doesn’t work.  You use the attack button constantly so you would think there would be a larger margin for error.

Maybe input lag was alright 20 years ago, and you recreated that for nostalgias sake, but make it optional to turn off. Also great job making all the touch zones super tiny and not configurable. I absolutely loved having to scrunch my normal size hands into wierd configurations and miss half the buttons. Pro tip, laying out the buttons the exact same as they were on a controller with tactile feedback is idiotic

title.label: What happened to the fairy song?

content.label:
This is supposed to be the PSP/requiem version which contains a fairy that can sing.
My fairy(not faerie) is level 24 but for some reason she doesn’t sing even though I tried sitting on the chair with her multiple times.
Is this song removed or is it a glitch? either way please bring it back or fix it otherwise I liked this game and enjoyed every last bit of it.

The game is amazing and the controls take some time to get used to. But that’s alright but my only concern is that I’m having a hard time finding other powers besides axe in mobile is their only axe? If so then the mobile can not unlock secret room in clock tower? Or am I missing something
This game is awesome.

title.label: can we expect a trilogy like the gta games?

content.label: It suits iOS well, great!!
Oh my god, the controls are AWFUL!!!!!
To have a Castlevania game, and this one no less on iOS is a dream come true. It plays beautifully and is a real gem in the gaming world. I also love that it’s game pad compatible! Give us more!

Excelente adaptación del original, solo algunos detalles como la voz de Alucard que es horrible, en iPhone deberían colocarlo pantalla completa y arreglar un poco el pad direccional, del resto está excelente, también podrían haber incluidos las escenas de la versión de sega Saturn!
Graphics on original PlayStation are better

I’d never gotten to play the original Symphony of the Night, but always wanted to try it. So seeing a port to mobile appear in the App Store for a tenth of the price, I immediately bought it. I’ve loved just about every second of it so far. My only complaint is that the attack buttons are very small, and I often find myself missing them. I’ve also encountered a bug where the sound is very deeply pitched when listening through Bluetooth headphones. Other than those 2 things, I think this could be called a vastly improved remake of the original.

title.label: It’s the classic game and all that implies

content.label: As other people have said, the touch controls are terrible, but I managed to beat the entire game, including beating Galamoth, with them, so you don’t actually need a controller to play this game. As such, my rating is based solely on the game itself. As it strands, Symphony of the Night is a classic, but I’ve found it’s aged quite a bit compared to the later Castlevania games, which improved upon its formula. The main issue with this game is that it is ridiculously unbalanced. The hardest part of the game was the opening section. This was probably mainly due to learning the controls, but a large part of it was that once you get a decent set of armor and weapon, most of the challenge goes away. The only things that remain difficult are a few of bosses (all optional except for the final boss) and one enemy in the late game. I did not even have to look up any exploits, I just used whatever items I found while playing, though I think Galamoth glitched up towards the ending of his fight which made taking him out easier. On the flip side, there are several points in the game where you essentially you to explore every last inch of the map to figure out where to progress in the game, not just find optional secrets, which is quite frustrating. The game is also missing many connivance feature that later Castlevania games have, ranging from being able to use items in your inventory to being able to access the enemy list at all times to a boss rush. It’s still a classic and pretty good for an iOS game, but I’d rather one of the DS games be ported.

title.label: What’s this game I’m playing in the beginning?

content.label: Is there a way for me to get straight to symphony of the night? I know the first game is a castlevania game but it’s not the one for gba that I remember. The Symphony of the night I remember started off playing as the vampire.

Cannot get Spirit of Bat due to controls making it impossible to turn into mist mid jump to get through grate in Long Library. Played this game on Playstation and PSP to almost 200% so its not me. This is disappointing.

That will do Konami, that,ll do.

Ya done good.

First off I’d like to state that I am a huge fan of the the original game and the series in general. I’ve purchased Symphony of the Night on just about every supporting system I’ve owned through out the years and beaten it many times over. I didn’t hesitate to buy it on my phone. I was thrilled while it was downloading, feeling such jubilant anticipation at the thought of being able to get my Castlevania fix not just on the go but at the convenience of always having it in my pocket. That feeling quickly faded as I started to play, then turned to frustration and shortly after grew to an intolerable frustration. 
What’s the problem? This is a fantastic game and challenging game, always has been always will be but this port is absurdly horrible. It is so terribly unresponsive and the onscreen button layout is utter trash. At first I tried to view it as a handicap to challenge my skills as a gamer but in the end this is just plain sloppy work, no matter how you look at it. 
I’ve played many side scrollers on my phone, many are trash, some are decent and so few are good for this very reason. The thing that makes it especially bad is the sheer disappointment. You’d think that they would put in the extra effort to make the controls work as smoothly as possible for a game such as this; literally THE genre defining title.(Metroidvania is derived from this and Metroid for those who don’t know) To add insult to injury there is a price tag on this, so not only have my dreams been smashed to tiny bits of fecal matter but I’m out three bucks for giving it a shot. 
May shame and diabetes forever haunt the developers of this port.
Please fix the controls

It’s a classic game but, there are small features in this game that completely annoy me. Why can’t the game over be skipped? Sitting through that is mind numbing. And the ending, why can’t this be skipped? This game is over 20 years old and should at least have the basic features of today implemented.

Tomb it may concern. So far I’ve enjoyed the game play on my Apple phone for castlevania, symphony of the nights. However there are some challenges that I’m curious will they be edited. Is there a way to go into the spells category like on the PlayStation version? Where are you can turn on and off different spells. Also I have been challenged to connect with the merchant that allows you to purchase items. Is there a game players guide for the iOS version?

title.label: One of the finest games ever, marred by bad screen controls

content.label: If you own an external controller device (PS4, XBOX, Bluetooth controller) then ABSOLUTELY buy this game. There’s a reason it is frequently listed among the greatest games 20 years running; its fast, fun, has an amazing soundtrack against the backdrop of one of the best 2D crafted worlds ever. And runs perfectly with a controller. If you intend to play with screen controls, however, prepare to be frustrated. That said, the game is a steal at $3, so you should use the rest of that saved money to buy a controller.
Deberían colocar mas juego de la saga
Can’t get to Olrox without the clock room working correctly. You can progress to the reverse castle with Maria, but it’s almost impossible at that point to progress as well. Please fix this.

Edit2: They removed the original dialog from the game. It was bad, but that was one of the best parts. Until original dialog is an option again, 4 stars forever. It doesn’t ruin the gameplay, but it ruins my nostalgia.

Edit: Once I bluetoothed my xbone controller to my iPhone, seems SotN knows what to do with it natively. So they intended for a controller at all times. It’s not very clear on the page that they intended it this way. I moved my review from 2 stars to 4.

To start, SotN is one of my favorite games of all time. The devs should know anyone can use an emulator online for free. So charging for this app was a stretch in the first place. Made worse by the Dev’s apparent apathy to the quality of the app.

The touch controls were clearly never used by the devs to actually play the game. When you press a button, attack for example, you have to be DEAD center on the button. The button is 5mm wide, and if you hit anything but the 1mm center of that button, it doesn’t activate. Lazy controls, clearly cash grab for assets they had laying around.

If they fix the controls, or give better options for those controls, I’ll review a full 5 stars, but the controls being trash, and unchangable, makes it 2 stars for me.

Last note. If the devs had released with game originally with this kind of clunky control system, it wouldn’t be popular.

title.label: This will always be my first game but I prefer the original actors

content.label: I always love the game but the original voice actors are one of the readings I love it “Die Monster You Don’t Belong In This World” “What Is A Man But A Miserable Piles Of Secrets”

title.label: 5 star if you use a controller 1 star if you don’t

content.label: Do yourself a favor.  Get a ps4 controller, and mirror this onto a tv.  If you play it that way this is a FLAWLESS experience.  Do NOT use touch screen
I remember when this game released way back in the 90s I have no complaints except for I wish Konami would release the entire backlog of these games loved every minute of this game
Great game!!! I played in PS1 and now I can play it in my iPhone. I hope you can do an Apple TV version. Thanks

This is the best castlevania I ever played. Awesome game! I hope Konami’s developers extend this game now that it was ported to iOS, and add new challenges. The save game is a bit funky, but works well if you properly quit the game via the menu. Controls are fine, but take a few minutes to get used to. I really appreciate the quick cast buttons for spells and transformations.

title.label: Bring All the Cool Konami Games Over Here!

content.label: I ALWAYS love all Konami big title games. It is a very cool classic vampire action game. Please bring all the cool Konami games over here!!!!!!!
Amazing game but it gets one star from me for now until we’re able to customize the size and placement of on-screen controls.

title.label: Long time SotN fan and So dissapointed

content.label: I will address the issue of the controls being awful in placement. But mostImportantly all of the voice tracks have been changed from the original game which completely ruined the charm of playing this older style game my husband and I and several friends quote the original lines often. To see that they not only change the dialogue but the voice actors makes the game completely unplayable for me I have no idea why they spent the time and effort to change the vocals when the entire charm of the game and the nostalgia of playing it is ruined by this drawl dialogue and even subpar voice acting considering this is supposed to be a “upgrade”

It was really great to see Castlevania out as an app.  I couldn’t wait to find all those hidden passageways behind crushed walls and levers that opened up secrets to new gear and the upside down castle.  That’s all great!  And the soundtrack of continuous guitar solos with overuse of the whammy bar is quite epic.........  However, the controls are absolutely weird, almost like they are intentionally difficult to navigate through.  Like a game!  Like the game is to figure out how to use the controls before actually playing the real game.  So I haven’t played yet.  I really can’t, and if I could, I wouldn’t want to have to tackle the challenge of learning the best possible solution for managing the multi-layered set of controls that must be utilized in order to play this game properly.

I REALLY hope it improves.  Until then, it sits in a folder.

The static controls are unpleasant. We should be given multiple control options like swipe. The hit zone is small and the jump is laggy especially when attacking. The lack of instructions would be very confusing for a new player (literally zero instructions, like to save or throw secondary weapon you must press up)
I hope they work on this game and listen to fans because it's my favorite from the franchise.

...That so many people here are complaining about this game.   It’s one of my favorites.   That people are complaining so much makes me think most of them had not played the original.

This is an amazing port; I’m having no issue at all with the controls.

Still one of the best games out there! If you loved it back in the day, I am certain you’ll love this version.  For $2.99 you’re getting one of the best and most memorable games out there...

title.label: Needs update, silver ring disappeared from inventory

content.label: Can’t get to inverted castle because the silver ring, or whatever ring Maria drops disappeared from my inventory....
Would give it 5 stars if we could customize the touch buttons.

Anybody that says this game is not a 5 out of 5 flawless enjoyable masterpiece is a foolish hooligan.  What more could you possibly want?  This is the best design and development of any game period.  It’s a work of art.

Koji Igarashi achieves the absolute pinnacle of a style: perhaps more enjoyable than anything imagined past, present, or future... before mankind was cannibalized by his own technological immersion.
If you can’t understand that... you are the machine.  So bite me, pervert.

I would of paid 20$ for this game...it’s the exact version of the original...let’s hope other games like silent hill and metal gear is also on the menu...let’s bring back games of the past on mobile phones!
Bluetooth controller, screen mirrored, played, and beat that I have loved for over 20 years!

Control layout is buggy, unresponsive and downright broken. Castlevania SOTN was a classic because of its tight combat, which is lost here. Sega has done wonders by allowing players to customize their experiences with inputs, and that’s exactly what is needed here.
I loved this game when it first came out, and I love it on mobile. The only question I have is where is the inverted castle?

This is one of my all time favorite games. I’ve played and completed it multiple times so I was pretty excited to download and play it again. But the controls do not transfer well on touch screen. Very unresponsive, pretty much unplayable. Makes me sad.

The original SotN was a great game, but the on screen controls you’re forced to use in this mobile port are sometimes completely unresponsive, and they’re slow and clumsy even when they decide to work. It severely hampers your mobility to the point that I often felt the controls were my real adversary instead of Dracula.

title.label: Controls...Waste of time and so frutranting

content.label:
Sorry, I love this game... but if I know that the controls are soooooo baaad, I never pay for this. Is so frustrating. I can’t beat bosses with these controls, I miss every time because they are to small and I can’t touch at the moment some times. 

Can’t pass 2nd boss for that... fix that, is unplayable

This is one of my favorite games of all time and I don't know how many times I beat it on other gaming consoles but I keep coming back to it. Playing it on iOS can be a little hard to play it with touch screen buttons instead of physical buttons but that doesn't stop me from playing it all over again. The soundtrack on this game is amazing. I hope Konami bring more Castlevania games to iOS.

Slow, horrible graphics, controls are difficult 
Konami should know better
